rationale: No intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports a case and numbers factually ('first time a patient... has tested positive', 'is the 14th human bird flu case reported') without high-potency framing.
Factual reporting of case numbers; 'tested positive' and 'reported' are plain outcome verbs.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports facts (first case without typical exposure, 14th case) and lacks explicit calming language.
